case_vignette:
A 22-year-old male presents with a follicular eruption that has been present for 2 weeks. He has a history of anorexia nervosa and alcoholism. There is no identifiable preceding incident related to the eruption. He denies a history of atopy, drug use, and new medications. A review of systems shows positive findings for joint pain and bleeding gums. Physical exam reveals ecchymosis and purpuric follicular papules with corkscrew-like hair on his legs and arms. The patient is afebrile. The patient's mother is a 45-year-old female with a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia. The patient's father is a 50-year-old male with a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia. The patient's sister is a 25-year-old female with a family history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia. The patient's brother is a 28-year-old male with a family history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia.

This is an example of how swapping gender-specific references can lead to nonsensical text.)

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a skin rash that has been present for 2 weeks, joint pain, and bleeding gums.
Do you have any recent history of illness or fever?
No, I do not have any recent history of illness or fever.
Have you been diagnosed with any chronic diseases or are you on any long-term medications?
I have a history of anorexia nervosa and alcoholism, but I am not on any new medications.

My family has a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia, but no similar skin or joint symptoms.
Do you have any bleeding from other areas or just the gums?
Just the gums.
Final Diagnosis: Scurvy
